intro: Draba oreades proles alpicola, commonly known as the alpine rockcress, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Alps and surrounding mountain ranges. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine meadows and scree slopes. It has a low, mat-forming growth habit with basal leaves and is well adapted to cold, harsh environments. Draba oreades proles alpicola is known for its resilience and is often found in areas with limited soil and extreme climatic conditions.
